thread.title: Drone used to inspect Manawatu Gorge slip
thread.title_full: Drone used to inspect Manawatu Gorge slip

title: Drone used to inspect Manawatu Gorge slip
text:
Drone used to inspect Manawatu Gorge slip 
Friday 17 Jul 2015 12:01 p.m. See the photo gallery 
By 3 News online staff 
Geotechnical engineers are using a drone to inspect the site of a rockfall which has closed State Highway 3 at the Manawatu Gorge. 
Heavy overnight rain caused around 200 cubic metres of rock and debris onto the road forcing the closure of the highway once again until at least 5pm. 
The rockfall, around 5km northwest of Woodville, shut the road early this morning. An alternative route is available via Saddle Rd. 
The New Zealand Transport Agency says engineers are at the site checking the material above the slip to make sure it's safe for crews to clear the road. 
Unstable material has already been identified which needs to be removed. 
Today's closure is the latest in at least two nature-related closures this year, with another rock slip in April and flooding closing the road in June. 
A truck carrying animal blood which left the road and teetered over the edge also reduced the highway to one lane last week, then closed it briefly while a crane removed the vehicle. 
3 News
